description.plain:
A bona fide national treasure in her home country and ever-broadening global fan base – Astrid S has near to 1 billion streams on Spotify alone.

In her five years in the studio so far, Astrid S has learned that it is sometimes the best songs that come fastest. ‘I knew it was something special,’ says Astrid S of her forthcoming pop smash, “Emotion”, ‘because I took a sneaky demo of it back to my hotel that night and couldn’t stop playing it.’ “Emotion” is an ebullient smash hit in the wings, a rush of pop blood to the head.

The journey for Astrid S toward superstardom is one of escape and destiny. She was born in the tiny Norwegian hamlet of Berkåk. ‘In the heart of Norway,’ she says, ‘quite literally.’ Music was her first love, soccer her second. She dropped out of a football school to enter Norwegian Idol at 16 and promptly earned her first indigenous top 10 hit, “Shattered”.

She signed to Sony ATV Music Publishing as a songwriter that year. Since, Astrid has been honing her brilliant ear for a pop chorus and identifiable, genre-bending lyric. ‘I had this idea that I wanted to make something modern and hopefully stand the test of time,’ she says. ‘It’s so great to have got there.’ With “Emotion”, she intends to break a few more rules. ‘Boys can sing from any perspective, you notice that a lot. I want to be able to, too.’

Astrid S recalls exactly what pop music made her feel like as a young girl in a small town. ‘The moment I put a Discman on I was in another world. It was magical.’ Now she is ready to translate that early metamorphosis for her own fans. ‘To give them a world to get lost in as well.’ She is ready to colonize pop music with her own indefatigable energy. ‘Now I feel ready to fly.’

songs.full_title: Hurts So Good by Astrid S
songs.title: Hurts So Good

description.plain:
“Hurts So Good” describes a broken relationship between two lovers who keep running back to each other, knowing that they’ll get hurt again. The song was released on the 6th of May as the second single off her self-titled debut EP, Astrid S.

This is the first song by Astrid to attract major audiences worldwide, having nearly 50 million plays on Spotify by the end of August, three months after its release.

description.plain: Following the massive success of her second EP “Party’s Over”, Astrid drops Think Before I Talk, a semi-acoustic anthem for people who run their mouths way too fast.

songs.lyrics:
25 ContributorsThink Before I Talk Lyrics[Verse 1]
I said I hate you, I was angry
I got so mad, I slammed your door
You know I really love you, baby
I didn't mean to start a war
And I know there's a line, but I crossed it
And I pray that it won't leave a scar
I said I hate you, but I'm sorry
Sometimes I wish you'd cut me off

[Chorus]
Maybe I should think before I talk
I get emotional and words come out all wrong
Sometimes I'm more honest than I want
So maybe I should think before
Maybe next time, I'll think before I talk
[Verse 2]
I try my best to make it better (better)
I'm all out of apologies (apologies)
You know I'm not good under pressure (pressure)
Guess hurting you is hurting me
I took all that we built and I broke it
And I pray it won't tear us apart
So let me piece it back together
I know I cut you pretty deep (know I cut you pretty deep)

[Chorus]
Maybe I should think before I talk
I get emotional and words come out all wrong
Sometimes I'm more honest than I want
So maybe I should think before
Maybe next time, I'll think before
I know that I should think before I speak
'Cause I'm saying things that I don't even mean
Maybe I'm more honest than I wanna be
So maybe I should think before
Maybe next time, I'll think before I

[Bridge]
Say something I might regret
And I might get too far under your skin
I can't lie, I wish we could try it again
Oh I, I wish we could try it again
You might also like[Chorus]
Maybe I should think before I talk
I get emotional and words come out all wrong
Sometimes I'm more honest than I want
So maybe I should think before
Maybe next time, I'll think before
I know that I should think before I speak
'Cause I'm saying things that I don't even mean
Maybe I'm more honest than I wanna be
So maybe I should think before
Maybe next time, I'll think before I talk

[Outro]
Oh, oh, oh, oh
So maybe I should think before
Maybe next time, I'll think before I talk34Embed

album.full_title: Astrid S - EP by Astrid S
album.name: Astrid S - EP

songs.lyrics:
11 ContributorsPaper Thin Lyrics[Verse 1]
My heart feels like the sharpest razor blade
I really hope this won't give me away
'Cause I've been drowning here for days
Like a watercolor about to fade
Every inch of me is there to trace
No secrets left here on my page
Underneath my skin, I see a change
Blood races right up to my face

[Chorus]
Bursting out, no, I can't take it
You really wore me down
Read my mind just like I'm naked
There's no hiding now
I'm paper thin, paper thin
Paper thin, paper thin
[Verse 2]
You make me feel like a piece of art
Hanging on your wall, just like my heart
Making shadows even in the dark
I'm see-through but I won't fall apart

[Chorus]
Bursting out, no, I can't take it
You really wore me down
Read my mind just like I'm naked
There's no hiding now
I'm paper thin, paper thin
Paper thin, paper thin
Paper thin, paper thin
Paper thin

[Bridge]
Slowly you've been wearing me down
Pulling up my roots from the ground
The way I feel's so obvious now
'Cause I'm paper thin in love with you now

[Chorus]
I'm bursting out, no, I can't take it
You really wore me down
Read my mind just like I'm naked
There's no hiding now
I'm paper thin, paper thin
Paper thin, paper thin
Paper thin, paper thin
Paper thinYou might also like6Embed
